name: afterRequest
description: A method that fires each time after a request is made. Note: this is an event that is fired after each request and not how you would retrieve the data from each individual request.

name: apiConfig
description: Rapid takes advantage of the awesome framework, axios. This is any configuration that you'd like to pass to `axios`.

name: baseURL
description: The base url for your api.

name: caseSensitive
description: If for some reason you need to keep your urls case sensitive you can do so by setting this to true.

name: debug
description: If set to true, this will enable the debugger and all requests will be logged in the console and not actually made. See debugging for more info.

name: defaultRoute
description: There are two routes generated by default: `model` and `collection`. By default `model` is set.

name: modelName
description: The model name for the rapid model. This will determine the routes for both models and collections. The collection route will be generated as the plural version of this. For instance if you put `gallery` the collection route would become `galleries`. Using camel case will result in a delimited route as defined in `routeDelimeter`

name: onError
description: The API request returns a promise. All errors thrown from the request's Promise.catch() method will be passed into this method.

name: primaryKey
description: The primary key to be used in the url.

name: routeDelimeter
description: The delimeter for route model/collection names.

name: suffixes
description: The suffixes for the create(), update(), and destroy() methods. If you want to override any of them, you can here.

name: trailingSlash
description: Whether or not to append a trailing slash to API urls.
